revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Yuri Milner | image = Yuri Milner.jpg | caption = Yuri Milner | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|11|11|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Moscow]], [[Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic|Russian SFSR]],
[[Soviet Union]] | residence = [[Los Altos Hills, California]] | nationality = [[State of Israel|Israel]]i, Russian | alma_mater = [[Moscow State University]]
[[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania]] ([[MBA]]) | occupation = Businessman: [[venture capital]]ist, founder of [[Digital Sky Technologies]] (DST Global) | spouse = {{marriage|Julia Bochkova|2004}} | children = 3 daughters | networth = {{increase}} US$3.7 billion (2018){{cite news |title= The World's Billionaires: #606 Yuri Milner |url= https://www.forbes.com/profile/yuri-milner/ |work=[[Forbes]] |date= March 2018}} }} '''Yuri Borisovich (Bentsionovich) Milner'''Fund to facilitate the preparation of the 300-year anniversary of St. Petersburg. - ''St. Petersburg Vedomosti'', 30.05.2003. - № 319. ({{lang-ru|Ю́рий Бори́сович Бенцио́нович Ми́льнер}}; born 11 November 1961[http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/172249 Новый зампред МЕНАТЕПа] - New deputy chairman on MENATEP – ''Kommersant'', 11.02.1997. - № 8) is an Israeli-Russian entrepreneur, venture capitalist and [[physicist]]. Milner is Russia's most influential [[information technology|tech]] investor as the founder of investment firms [[Digital Sky Technologies]] (DST){{cite web|author=Owen Matthews |url=http://www.newsweek.com/2011/01/06/yuri-milner-facebook-s-russian-sugar-daddy.html |title=Yuri Milner: Facebook's Russian Sugar Daddy |publisher=''The Daily Beast'' |date=6 January 2011 |accessdate=2011-08-18}} now called [[Mail.ru|Mail.ru Group]] and DST Global. Through DST Global, Milner is an investor in [[Facebook]], [[Zynga]], [[Twitter]], [[Flipkart]], [[Spotify]], [[Zocdoc]], [[Groupon]], [[JD.com]], [[Xiaomi]], [[OlaCabs]], [[Alibaba Group|Alibaba]], [[Airbnb]], [[WhatsApp]], [[Nubank]], [[Wish (company)|Wish]] and many others. Milner's personal investments also include a stake in [[23andMe]],{{cite news| url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/matthewherper/2012/12/11/23andme-nabs-billionaire-yuri-milner-as-investor-cuts-price-to-99/ |title=23andMe Nabs Billionaire Yuri Milner As Investor, Cuts Price To $99| work=[[Forbes]] | first=Matthew | last=Herper | date=11 December 2012}} [[Habito]], [[Planet Labs]], minority stake in a real estate investments start-up, Cadre, founded by [[Jared Kushner]],{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/05/world/yuri-milner-facebook-twitter-russia.html |title=Kremlin Cash Behind Billionaire’s Twitter and Facebook Investments; Leaked files show that a state-controlled bank in Moscow helped to fuel Yuri Milner’s ascent in Silicon Valley, where the Russia investigation has put tech companies under scrutiny. |author=Jesse Drucker |date=November 5, 2017 |website=[[NYTimes.com]] |access-date=8 March 2018 |quote=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-11-06/leaked-documents-link-trumps-commerce-secretary-to-russia/9075622 |title=Leaked documents link Trump’s Commerce Secretary to Putin cronies |authors=Four Corners with the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists |date=November 5, 2017 |website=[[Abc.net.au]] |access-date=8 March 2018}} and others. In September 2017 Forbes included Milner to the list of 100 greatest living business minds.https://www.forbes.com/100-greatest-business-minds/ Milner was named one of the World's Greatest Leaders by ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'' magazine in March 2017,{{cite news|url=http://fortune.com/worlds-greatest-leaders/yuri-milner-40//|title=The World's 50 Greatest Leaders|work=Fortune}} was listed in the "Titans" category of ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine's 2016 [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]].{{cite web|url=http://time.com/collection/2016-time-100/|title=The 100 Most Influential People - TIME|website=time.com|accessdate=8 June 2017}} ''[[Foreign Policy]]'' magazine included Milner on its "Power List" – an inaugural list of the 500 most powerful people on the planet in May 2013.{{cite web|url=https://foreignpolicy.com/articles/2013/04/29/the_500_most_powerful_people_in_the_world|title=The FP Power Map|publisher=|accessdate=8 June 2017|work=[[Foreign Policy]]}} Milner was included in [[Bloomberg Markets]]' 2012 [[50 Most Influential (Bloomberg Markets ranking)|50 Most Influential]] list. In ''Fortune''{{'}}s 2010 list of the world's fifty most prominent businessmen, Milner was ranked 46th. That same year Russian business magazine ''[[Vedomosti]]'' recognized him as "Businessman of the Year".[http://www.vedomosti.ru/persons/1162/ Yuri Milner] in the directory ''[[Vedomosti]]'' ==Early life and education== Born into a [[Jewish]] family[https://www.wired.com/magazine/2011/10/mf_milner/all/ Wired Magazine: "How Russian Tycoon Yuri Milner Bought His Way Into Silicon Valley" By Michael Wolff] 21 October 2011{{cite web|last=Mousumi Saha Kumar|title=Self-Made Billionaire Investor Yuri Milner Sets $3 Million Prize for Physics|url=http://www.successstories.co.in/self-made-billionaire-investor-yuri-milner-sets-3-million-prize-for-physics/|accessdate=13 October 2013}} on 11 November 1961 in Moscow, Yuri Milner was the second child of Russian intellectuals.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/forbes/2011/0328/billionaires-11-profile-yuri-milner-billionaire-friended-web.html |title=The Billionaire Who Friended the Web |publisher=Forbes |date=28 March 2011 |accessdate=2011-08-18 |first=Parmy |last=Olson}} His father, {{ill|Bentsion Zakharovitch Milner|ru|Мильнер, Бенцион Захарович}}, was active in the sphere of management and organisation. He was Chief Deputy Director at the Institute of Economics of the [[Russian Academy of Sciences]].{{cite web|url=http://www.guu.ru/info.php?id=1978 |title=Официальный сайт Государственного Университета Управления |publisher=Guu.ru |date= |accessdate=2011-08-18}} Betty Iosifovna Milner, Yuri's mother, worked at the capital's state-run virological laboratory for disease control. His older sister, eight years his senior, is an architect. Milner studied [[theoretical physics]] at [[Moscow State University]], graduating in 1985. He went on to work at [[Lebedev Physical Institute]], one of the institutes of the [[Russian Academy of Sciences]], in the same department as the [[Nobel Prize]] winner [[Vitaly Ginzburg]]. As a doctoral candidate in particle physics, Milner befriended Soviet [[nuclear physicist]] and [[human rights]] activist [[Andrei Sakharov]]. Sakharov's forward thinking would later influence Milner's venture investment strategy.{{cite news|author=Parmy Olson |url=https://blogs.forbes.com/parmyolson/2011/03/10/yuri-milner-billionaire-facebook-day-in-the-life/ |title=A Day In The Life Of Yuri Milner, Web Billionaire s |publisher=Blogs.forbes.com |date= |accessdate=2011-08-18}} In 1990, Milner became the first non-[[émigré]] from the Soviet Union to go to the United States to receive an [[MBA]] at the [[Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania]].{{cite news| url=http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/movers_and_shakers/article6391401.ece | location=London | work=The Times | first=Mike | last=Harvey | title=Big shot Yuri Milner makes logical expansion of his network | date=30 May 2009}} The press quoted him as saying that he made this decision after "being disappointed in myself as a physicist".https://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/newsmaker-yuri-milner-115072301441_1.html Milner was a commencement speaker for Wharton Business School 2017 class. https://graduation.wharton.upenn.edu/graduation-speakers/wharton-graduation-2017-speakers-announced/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZlwMm5XehPg ==Business career== Milner started his business career selling [[grey market]] DOS computers in the Soviet Union, which displeased his father. When the national government collapsed, he stopped selling computers to enroll at the Wharton School to earn an MBA.{{cite web| publisher=WIRED | title=How Russian Tycoon Yuri Milner Bought His Way Into Silicon Valley | url=https://www.wired.com/2011/10/mf_milner/all/1 | author=Michael Wolff | date=21 October 2011}} After graduating, Milner spent the first half of the 1990s at the [[World Bank]] in [[Washington, D.C.]], as a Russian banking specialist focused on the development of private sector banking. He has described his time at the World Bank as his "lost years", due to watching from afar the privatization of government holdings during the presidency of [[Boris Yeltsin]]. In the spring of 1995, Milner was appointed CEO of Alliance-Menatep, an [[investment broker]]age company belonging to then oligarch [[Mikhail Khodorkovsky]]. In December 1996 Milner worked as Vice President and Head of Investment Management of Menatep Bank. In February 1997 Milner was appointed the deputy chairman and the head of the investment division of [[Menatep Bank]] but left this position in early 1998http://moneymakerfactory.ru/spravochnik/yuriy-milner-istoriya-biznesa/. At the time, the market makers described him as "a well-known professional, who will bring the bank valuable experience in international financial institutions and transactions in the Russian investment market"https://lenta.ru/lib/14190841/. ===Russian Internet investor=== In 1999, after reading a review by [[Morgan Stanley]] analyst [[Mary Meeker]] on the prospects for online businesses, Milner decided to create an internet company. He sought funding from his friend from Menatep days Gregory Finger, who at the time led the Russian branch of the US investment fund New Century Holding. The fund agreed to invest $4.5 million with the proviso that Milner and Finger each personally invest $750,000. Milner, Finger, and NCH created a new company, NetBridge.{{cite web|url=https://lenta.ru/lib/14190841/#43|title=Мильнер, Юрий|website=lenta.ru|accessdate=8 June 2017}} In 2000, Milner became the president of Netbridge Services Ltd (netBridge) – the company that was, "created as an Internet incubator and investment fund". Netbridge succeeded in transferring a variety of U.S.-pioneered internet business models to Russia, creating companies including the portal List.ru, online auction site Molotok.ru (based on [[eBay]]), free web-hosting Boom.ru (based on [[GeoCities]]), and online shop 24×7, using the formula of [[Amazon.com]]. In February 2001, netBridge and Port.ru (which owned Mail.ru) announced a merger. Milner became CEO of the new company named Mail.ru (though the legal name Port.ru was also retained). From January 2003 to December 2004, Milner was the CEO of "Neftyanoi", owned by [[Igor Linshits]].{{Citation needed|date=November 2017}} In 2005, NCH shifted its focus from Russian Internet projects and Milner founded the investment fund Digital Sky Technologies (DST), becoming its chairman in 2006. A meeting through mutual friends resulted in [[Alisher Usmanov]] becoming a shareholder of Mail.ru Group in 2008. In 2010 Mail.ru Group completed successful [[initial public offering]] on the [[London Stock Exchange]] with market valuation of $5.6 billion.Mail.Ru Group IPO Pricing Announcement http://www.londonstockexchange.com/exchange/news/market-news/market-news-detail.html?announcementId=10706676{{dead link|date=July 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In March 2012, Milner stepped down from the role of chairman of Mail.ru and from the board of directors.Mail.ru Group press release http://corp.mail.ru/en/press/news/1339 Dmitry Grishin was elected to the board and appointed as chairman while retaining his CEO position. There were no other changes to management or to the board. Post Mail.ru Group’s IPO, DST is the sole vehicle for further international investments. The company is now fully independent of Mail.ru Group.Mail.ru Group prospectus {{cite web|url=http://www.rns-pdf.londonstockexchange.com/rns/7389V_-2010-11-5.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=10 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120317075041/http://www.rns-pdf.londonstockexchange.com/rns/7389V_-2010-11-5.pdf |archivedate=17 March 2012 }} From May 2009 to January 2012 Milner was a member of the Commission on Modernization established by [[Dmitry Medvedev]], the Russian President from 2008 to 2012.{{cite web|url=http://premier.gov.ru/en/|title=Dmitry Medvedev - The Russian Government|work=premier.gov.ru}} ===International Internet investor=== In January 2009, while in [[Palo Alto]], Milner became acquainted with [[Facebook]] founder [[Mark Zuckerberg]]. The meeting led to an agreement on 26 May 2009 under which DST bought a 1.96% stake in Facebook for $200 million.{{cite news|last=Gustin|first=Sam|title=Time Tech 40: The Most Influential Minds in Tech|url=http://business.time.com/2013/05/01/time-tech-40-the-ten-most-influential-tech-ceos/slide/yuri-milner-dst/|publisher=Time|accessdate=12 February 2014|date=1 May 2013}} On 16 September 2010, Digital Sky Technologies (DST) changed its name to "Mail.ru Group". The group's portfolio included Mail.ru, Odnoklassniki.ru, [[ICQ]], a minority stake in the social network [[VKontakte]] (Russian Facebook equivalent), online payments service OSMP.ru, e‑Port, as well as some other Russian assets. Milner's commercial interests in Facebook, Zynga, and Groupon were transferred to [[DST Global]]. Milner became the CEO of DST Global and the chairman of the board of directors of Mail.ru Group. In November 2010, Mail.ru Group held its [[Public offering|offering]] on the [[London Stock Exchange]].{{cite web|title=Mail.ru Group Limited Announces Intention to Conduct an Initial Public Offering and Listing on the London Stock Exchange|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20101010005091/en/Mail.ru-Group-Limited-Announces-Intention-Conduct-Initial#.UvvtQUJdXso|publisher=BusinessWire|accessdate=12 February 2014}} In March 2012, Milner stepped down from the role of chairman of Mail.ru and from the board of directors. Milner focused on international Internet investments. DST Global became one of the world’s leading technology investors and its portfolio has included some of the world's most prominent internet companies, such as Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp, Snapchat, Airbnb, Spotify, Alibaba, and others.{{cite web|url=https://bloombergtechconference2016.sched.com/speaker/yuri_milner.1v7d8ns5|title=Yuri Milner's schedule for Bloomberg Tech Conference 2016|website=bloombergtechconference2016.sched.com|accessdate=8 June 2017}} On 5 November 2017, ''[[The New York Times]]'' reported that Milner had strong [[Kremlin]] backing for his investments in Facebook and Twitter. Milner denied this allegations in his open letter published in ReCode https://www.recode.net/2017/11/5/16610242/yuri-milner-russia-twitter-facebook-paradise-papers ===Selected investments=== On 29 January 2011, Milner announced that he would invest $150,000 into each of the start‑up program participants selected by the incubator [[Y Combinator (company)|Y Combinator]].{{cite web|last=Arrington|first=Michael|title=Start Fund: Yuri Milner, SV Angel Offer EVERY New Y Combinator Startup $150k|url=https://techcrunch.com/2011/01/28/yuri-milner-sv-angel-offer-every-new-y-combinator-startup-150k/|publisher=TechCrunch|accessdate=12 February 2014}} On 2 August 2011, [[DST Global]] invested $800 million in Twitter. In September 2011, [[DST Global]] together with [[Silver Lake Partners|Silver Lake]] launched $1.6 billion tender offer for shares in the Alibaba Group.{{cite web|url=https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2011/09/22/silver-lake-and-dst-begin-tender-offer-for-alibaba-shares/?_r=0|title=Silver Lake and DST Begin Tender Offer for Alibaba Shares|first=Evelyn M.|last=Rusli|website=nytimes.com|accessdate=8 June 2017}} DST Global invested $125 million in [[WhatsApp]].{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/parmyolson/2015/03/25/yuri-milners-unparalleled-global-tech-gold-mining-machine/|title=Yuri Milner's Unparalleled Global Tech Gold-Mining Machine|author=Parmy Olson|work=Forbes}} In February 2014, it was announced that Milner had led a round of funding for cloud-graphics company, Otoy.{{cite web|last=Takahashi|first=Dean|title=Russia’s premiere tech investor Yuri Milner invests in cloud graphics company Otoy|url=https://venturebeat.com/2014/02/11/russias-premiere-tech-investor-yuri-milner-invests-in-cloud-graphics-company-otoy/|publisher=Venture Beat|accessdate=12 February 2014}} In May 2014, Flipkart raised $210 million in a financing round Led by DST Global.{{cite web|url=http://forbesindia.com/article/special/dst-global-pumps-$210-million-into-flipkart/37870/1|title=Forbes India Magazine - DST Global pumps $210 million into Flipkart|work=forbesindia.com}} In March 2015, British online luxury fashion company Farfetch said it raised $86 million from investment firm DST Global and existing shareholders, valuing the company at $1 billion.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/03/04/us-farfetch-funding-idUSKBN0M025220150304|title=Online fashion company Farfetch raises $86 million from DST Global, others|work=Reuters | date=4 March 2015}} According to press reports, in April 2015 OlaCabs raised $315 million from DST Global and some existing investors.{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/7e417600-de8c-11e4-8a01-00144feab7de.html#axzz3XFZIKoEk|title=Ola Cabs raises fresh funds as it seeks to outrun Uber|work=Financial Times}} In April 2016, online mortgage broker platform [[Habito]] launched with backing from Milner, amongst other [[financial technology| fintech]] investors.O'Hear, Steve. [https://techcrunch.com/2016/04/12/habito/ "Habito is another London startup aiming for a slice of U.K.’s lucrative mortgage market"], ''[[TechCrunch]]'', London, 12 April 2016. Retrieved on 18 April 2016. =='Breakthrough' projects == ===Breakthrough Prize=== {{main|Breakthrough Prize}} In July 2012, Yuri and Julia Milner established the [[Breakthrough Prize]], joined the following year by [[Sergey Brin]], [[Priscilla Chan (philanthropist)|Priscilla Chan]], [[Anne Wojcicki]] and [[Mark Zuckerberg]]. The Prize is a set of international awards recognizing three fields of endeavor: [[Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics]], [[Breakthrough Prize in Life Sciences]], and [[Breakthrough Prize in Mathematics]]. Laureates receive $3 million each in prize money, making the Breakthrough Prizes the largest scientific awards in the world.[https://www.economist.com/blogs/babbage/2013/02/science-prizes Take that, Alfred.], The Economist There are also New Horizons awards in physics and mathematics for younger researchers who have already produced significant work. Committees of previous laureates choose the winners from candidates nominated in a process that is online and open to the public.{{cite web|url=https://breakthroughprize.org/?controller=Page&action=page&page_id=4|title=Breakthrough Prize: About|website=Breakthrough Prize}} {{As of|2017|March}}, $174.8m in prize-money has been awarded to 70 individual scientists and four large research teams.{{cite web|url=http://www.breakthroughprize.org|title=Breakthrough Prize|work=breakthroughprize.org}} The Prizes are presented annually at a gala ceremony featuring celebrity presentations, films, comedy and live music. The last four ceremonies took place at [[Hangar One (Mountain View, California)]]. The annual celebrations also includes symposiums in the three recognized fields. The program is broadcast live on the web.[https://www.msri.org/general_events/21230 Breakthrough Prize Symposium] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150414065535/https://www.msri.org/general_events/21230 |date=14 April 2015 }}, Mathematical Sciences Research Institute ===Breakthrough Initiatives=== {{main|Breakthrough Initiatives}} In July 2015, Milner launched [[Breakthrough Initiatives]], a scientific program to investigate the question of life in the [[Universe]]. He announced the initiatives at the [[Royal Society]] in London, alongside [[Stephen Hawking]], [[Martin Rees]], [[Frank Drake]], [[Geoff Marcy]] and [[Ann Druyan]]. {{cite news| url=http://www.scientificamerican.com/article/search-for-extraterrestrial-intelligence-nets-historic-cash-infusion/ | work=Scientific American | title=Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence Nets Historic Cash Infusion. | date=20 July 2015}} Three initiatives have been announced so far: * [[Breakthrough Listen]] * [[Breakthrough Message]] * [[Breakthrough Starshot]] The first, Breakthrough Listen, will invest $100 million over 10 years in a search for evidence of civilizations beyond Earth. {{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-33596271 | work=BBC | title=Prof Stephen Hawking backs venture to listen for aliens | date=20 July 2015}} Utilizing the [[Green Bank Telescope|Green Bank]], [[Parkes Observatory|Parkes]], [[Lick Observatory|Lick]],{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/21/science/yuri-milner-russian-entrepreneur-promises-100-million-for-alien-search.html | work=The New York Times | title=Stephen Hawking Joins Russian Entrepreneur's Search for Alien Life| date=20 July 2015}} and [[Five hundred meter Aperture Spherical Telescope|FAST]] observatories, Listen is searching for radio and laser signals from the nearest million stars, the nearest 100 galaxies, and the plane and center of the [[Milky Way]].{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2015/jul/20/breakthrough-listen-massive-radio-wave-project-scan-far-regions-for-alien-life | work=Guardian | title=Stephen Hawking launches $100m search for alien life beyond solar system | date=21 July 2015}} The initiative will also use the [[SETI@home]] distributed computing project. {{cite news| url=http://www.space.com/29990-stephen-hawking-intelligent-alien-life-initiative.html | work=Space.com | title=Stephen Hawking Helps Launch Massive Search for E.T. | date=20 July 2015}} The second initiative, Breakthrough Message, will be a $1 million annual prize for digital messages representing Earth and humanity, that could be decoded by another civilization. The messages will not be sent into space until a global discussion on the ethics of such a move has taken place. The third project, Breakthrough Starshot, was announced 12 April 2016.https://www.wired.co.uk/article/stephen-hawking-interstellar-travel-starmus-speech Starshot is a US$100 million program to develop a proof-of-concept [[light sail]] spacecraft fleet capable of making the journey to [[Alpha Centauri]] at 20% the [[speed of light]] (60 million m/s or 215 million km/h) taking about 20 years to get there, and about 4 years to notify Earth of a successful arrival.{{cite news |last=Overbye |first=Dennis |authorlink=Dennis Overbye |title=A Visionary Project Aims for Alpha Centauri, a Star 4.37 Light-Years Away |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/13/science/alpha-centauri-breakthrough-starshot-yuri-milner-stephen-hawking.html |date=12 April 2016 |work=[[New York Times]] |accessdate=12 April 2016 }}{{cite news |last= Stone |first=Maddie |url=https://gizmodo.com/a-russian-billionaire-and-stephen-hawking-want-to-build-1770467186 |title=Stephen Hawking and a Russian Billionaire Want to Build an Interstellar Starship |work=Gizmodo |date=12 April 2016 |accessdate=12 April 2016 }}{{cite web |url=http://breakthroughinitiatives.org/Initiative/3 |title=Breakthrough Starshot |work=Breakthrough Initiatives |date=12 April 2016 |accessdate=12 April 2016 }} On 20 April 2017, the Breakthrough Discuss conference was held, during which the results of a year worth of data analysis was discussed. According to the researchers, 692 stars were analyzed.{{Cite news|url=http://uk.businessinsider.com/breakthrough-listen-first-detection-results-2017-4?r=US&IR=T|title=A Russian tycoon's $100 million effort to listen for aliens has published its first results|work=Business Insider|access-date=2017-05-17|language=en}} ===Breakthrough Junior Challenge=== In September 2015, the Breakthrough Prize launched the Breakthrough Junior Challenge,[https://breakthroughjuniorchallenge.org/about], breakthroughjuniorchallenge.org[http://www.siliconbeat.com/2015/09/14/whiz-kids-wanted-for-breakthrough-junior-challenge-with-250000-prize/?doing_wp_cron=1488114979.6444370746612548828125], silicon beat.com a science competition for people between thirteen and eighteen years of age, in collaboration with [[Khan Academy]]. ==Long-term vision== Milner believes that the internet will develop into a "[[global brain]]"—which is often described as an intelligent network of individuals and machines—functioning as a nervous system for the planet Earth. He also envisages that the advent of the [[internet of things]] and ever increasing use of [[social media]] will increase humans' [[collective intelligence]].Chrystia Freeland: [http://blogs.reuters.com/chrystia-freeland/2011/09/23/the-advent-of-the-global-brain/ The advent of the global brain]Ben Parr:[http://mashable.com/2010/11/16/could-facebook-become-the-basis-for-artificial-intelligence/ Could Facebook Become the Basis for Artificial Intelligence?] ==Personal life== In an interview with ''[[Vedomosti]]'' in 2010, Milner said:
In the past few years I simply do not have time for hobbies. I am even starting to forget what I was fond of. Such as in the past it was reading of literature not related to work.{{cite news| url=http://www.vedomosti.ru/newspaper/articles/2010/12/28/nastupaet_era_lyudej_s_matematicheskim_skladom_uma_yurij | work=Vedomosti | first1=Anastasia | last1=Golitsyn | first2=Igor | last2=Tsukanov | title=There is coming an era for people with a mathematical state of mind | date=28 December 2010}}
Milner is married to former [[Haute couture|high fashion]] [[Model (profession)#Fashion models|model]] and contemporary artist Julia Milner ([[Married and maiden names|''née'']] Bochkova). She is interested in [[photography]]: during the 52nd Venice Biennale of Contemporary Art she produced a contribution entitled ''Click I Hope''.{{cite news| url=http://www.russiandreams.info/en/photographer/milner | work=Russian Dreams Info | title=RUSSIAN DREAMS | year=2008}} In 2011, Milner bought a $100 million home in [[Los Altos Hills]].{{cite news| url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/04/01/BUH21INM5M.DTL | work=The San Francisco Chronicle | first=Kathleen | last=Pender | title=Yuri Milner buys $100 million Los Altos Hills home | date=12 May 2011}} The compound spans three plots totaling seven hectares and includes a roughly {{convert|25500|sqft|m2|adj=on}} main house and a {{convert|5500|sqft|m2|adj=on}} guest house. The current tax bill is about $304,000 a year. ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' reported the price as $100 million, saying it was the most ever paid for a single-family home in the United States. The property is [[Real estate appraisal|appraised]] by the [[Santa Clara County]] assessor at $50 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/business/ci_20998327/russian-mogul-yuri-milner-silicon-valley-mansion-worth-half-its-price-100-million|title=Russian tycoon's Silicon Valley mansion worth half its $100 million purchase price, assessor says|work=mercurynews.com}} Milner lives in [[Silicon Valley]] with his family. Milner attends synagogue, but says that he is only minimally religiously observant. ==Awards and recognitions== * "The World's 50 Greatest Leaders" – ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'', April 2018.{{cite news|url=http://fortune.com/worlds-greatest-leaders/yuri-milner-40/ |title=The World's 50 Greatest Leaders|work=Fortune}} * "100 Greatest Living Business Minds" – ''Forbes'', September 2017.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/100-greatest-business-minds///|title=100 Greatest Living Business Minds|work=Fortune}} * "The World's 50 Greatest Leaders" – ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'', March 2017.{{cite news|url=http://fortune.com/worlds-greatest-leaders//|title=The World's 50 Greatest Leaders|work=Fortune}} * "The Midas List 2017" – ''Forbes'', April 2017.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/yuri-milner/?list=midas|title=The Midas List|work=Forbes}} * "The Wired 100 - 2016" – ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'', August 2016.{{cite news|url=https://www.wired.co.uk/article/wired-global-100/|title=The Wired 100|work=Wired}} * "The 100 Richest Tech Billionaires In The World In 2016" – ''Forbes'', August 2016.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/katevinton/2016/08/10/the-100-richest-tech-billionaires-in-the-world-in-2016/#71b85ba56b3f/|title=The 100 Richest Tech Billionaires In The World In 2016|work=Forbes}} * "Time 100 Most Influential People 2016" – ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'', April 2016.{{cite news|url=http://time.com/4300003/yuri-milner-2016-time-100/|title=The 100 Most Influential People|work=Time}} * "The Midas List 2016" – ''Forbes'', April 2016.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/yuri-milner/?list=midas/|title=The Midas List|work=Forbes}} * "The Midas China List 2016" – ''Forbes'', April 2016.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/pictures/hejl45fe/yuri-milner/|title=The Midas China List|work=Forbes}} * "New Establishment List 2015" – ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'', September 2015.{{cite news|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/news/photos/2015/09/new-establishment-list-2015|title=New Establishment Summit|work=Vanity Fair}} * "Wired 100" – ''Wired'', August 2015.{{cite news|url=https://www.wired.co.uk/magazine/archive/2015/09/features/the-2015-wired-100/viewall|title=Most influential people in European tech|work=Wired}} * "The Midas List 2014-" ''Forbes'', April 2015.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/midas/list/#tab:overall|title=The Midas List|work=Forbes}} * "New Establishment List 2014" – ''Vanity Fair'', September 2014.{{cite news|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/news/2016/10/new-establishment-2014|title=New Establishment Summit|work=Vanity Fair}} * "The Midas List 2013" – ''Forbes'', May 2013.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/midas/#%7c|title=The Midas List|work=Forbes}} * "Power Map: 500 most powerful people on the planet" – ''[[Foreign Policy]]'', May 2013.{{cite web|url=https://foreignpolicy.com/2013/04/29/the-fp-power-map/|title=ForeignPolicy - Power Map|work=[[Foreign Policy]]|accessdate=8 June 2017}} * "Most Influential 50" – ''[[Bloomberg Markets]]'', September 2012.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-09-07/most-influential-50-people-in-global-finance-full-list-bloomberg-markets.html|title=Most Influential 50 in Global Finance List: Bloomberg Markets|date=7 September 2011|work=Bloomberg.com}} * "The Silicon Valley 100" – ''[[Business Insider]]'', February 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/the-silicon-valley-100-1-100-2012-1|title=The Silicon Valley 100: 1-100|date=2 February 2012|work=Business Insider}} * "Top 50 Digital Power Players" – ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', January 2012.[http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/hollywood-reporter-digital-50-power-list-280333/group/Who%20Pays%20the%20Way Top 50 Digital Power Players], ''The Hollywood Reporter'' * "Businessperson of the Year – Top 50" – ''Fortune'', November 2011.{{cite news| url=http://money.cnn.com/galleries/2011/fortune/1111/gallery.business_person_year.fortune/index.html | work=CNN | title=2011 Businessperson of the Year}} * "Man of the Year" – ''[[GQ]]'' (Russian), October 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.gq.ru/talk/moty/3722/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=8 February 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111206005836/http://www.gq.ru/talk/moty/3722 |archivedate=6 December 2011 }} * "''Vanity Fair''{{'}}s New Establishment List 2011" – ''Vanity Fair'', September 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/business/new-establishment/2011/23-yuri-milner|title=The New Establishment 2011 - Yuri Milner|work=Vanity Fair}} * "Kommersant of the Year" – ''[[Kommersant]]'', June 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/1663066/print|title=Ъ-FM - "Коммерсантъ" одарил бизнесменов щедрой рукой|work=kommersant.ru}} * "The 100 Most Creative People" – ''[[Fast Company (magazine)|Fast Company]]'', May 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.fastcompany.com/most-creative-people/2011/yuri-milner-digital-sky-technologies|title=3. Yuri Milner|work=Fast Company|access-date=8 February 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120224004100/http://www.fastcompany.com/most-creative-people/2011/yuri-milner-digital-sky-technologies#|archive-date=24 February 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} * "The Midas List of Tech's Top Investors" - ''Forbes'', April 2011.{{cite news| url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/midas/2011/profile/yuri-milner.html|title=#25 Yuri Milner Digital Sky Technologies | work=Forbes}} * "World's Billionaires" – ''Forbes'', March 2011.{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/yuri-milner/|title=Yuri Milner|author=David Prosser|work=Forbes}} * "Owners of Virtual Reality List" – ''Forbes'' (Russian), February 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.forbes.ru/tehno-slideshow/internet-i-telekommunikatsii/63930-hozyaeva-virtualnoi-realnosti|title=ФОТО: Хозяева виртуальной реальности - Forbes.ru|work=forbes.ru}} * "Businessman of the Year" – ''[[Vedomosti]]'', December 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.vedomosti.ru/newspaper/article/252810/biznesmen_goda|title=ВЕДОМОСТИ - Бизнесмен года – Юрий Мильнер, основатель Mail.ru Group и DST Global|work=vedomosti.ru}} * "The Smartest People in Tech" – ''Fortune'', July 2010.{{cite news|url=http://money.cnn.com/galleries/2010/technology/1007/gallery.smartest_people_tech.fortune/40.html |work=CNN |title=The smartest people in tech |date=9 July 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118060750/http://money.cnn.com/galleries/2010/technology/1007/gallery.smartest_people_tech.fortune/40.html |archivedate=18 January 2012 }} ==See also== *[[List of people and organisations named in the Paradise Papers]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2011}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Milner, Yuri}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Giving Pledgers]] [[Category:Life extensionists]] [[Category:Russian billionaires]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]] [[Category:Russian venture capitalists]] [[Category:Russian Jews]] [[Category:People from Los Altos Hills, California]] [[Category:Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania alumni]] [[Category:Russian physicists]] [[Category:People from Moscow]]

{{Orphan|date=August 2016}}
{{Infobox exchange |name = İzmir Commodity Exchange ICE (İTB) |alt_name = İzmir Ticaret Borsası |logo = |image = Izmir Borsa.jpg |type = [[Commodities exchange]] |city = [[İzmir]] |country = Turkey |coor = |foundation= {{start date |1891}} |closed = |owner = |key_people= Işınsu Kestelli (President) |currency = [[Turkish lira]] (TRY) |commodity = Agricultural commodities |listings = |mcap = |volume = |indexes = |homepage = {{URL|http://itb.org.tr/en/}} |footnotes = }}
'''İzmir Commodity Exchange'''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://itb.org.tr/en/Page/8-ice-brochure|title=ICE Brochure {{!}} İzmir Ticaret Borsası|last=The ICE|first=İzmir Commodity Exchange {{!}}|date=|website=itb.org.tr|publisher=|access-date=2016-08-08}}</ref> (ICE) is a [[commodities exchange]] based in [[İzmir]], Turkey. It was the first commodities exchange established in Turky and focuses on agricultural products. It functions in accordance with the Turkish Law No. 5174 regarding the [[Union of Chambers and Commodity Exchanges of Turkey]] and the Chambers and Commodity Exchanges.
==History== The İzmir Commodity Exchange was established in İzmir, the 3rd largest province of Turkey, in 1891 as the first commodity exchange of Turkey.
İzmir has always been an important hub for agricultural production and one of the centers for domestic and foreign trade throughout the Ottoman Empire and the Republic of Turkey. In fact, İzmir harbour was the most important export harbour of the [[Ottoman Empire]] in the early 20th century, which made the city the host for the first efforts to systemize the agricultural markets and the first commodity exchange of Turkey.
In the second half of the 19th century, the boost in the volume of the trade in İzmir urged the merchants to seek for new methods and regulations in order to catch up with novelties. Although new warehouses had been built to store the goods, unbalanced price adjustments, lack of proper statistics to determine demand and supply, and uncertainty of the money markets used to negatively affect the commercial life of the city. These problems caused the tradesmen and producers to suffer great losses. The tradesmen of İzmir commenced to make several attempts to overcome these problems. The Commercial Assembly and İzmir Chamber of Commerce were established in 1850 and 1885, respectively. The English, French, Italians and the Dutch had their own chambers of commerce in İzmir. However, these attempts had fallen behind in creating solutions to the problems of the market.
Although the first legal arrangements in the Ottoman Empire were carried out in 1886, it is known that some attempts were made before this date to establish a commodity exchange in İzmir. It is also known that the building belonging to a tradesman called Nişli Hacı Ali Efendi was used as “the grain exchange” just before the 1890s. The arguments to establish a modern commodity exchange based on a legal status and conforming to certain rules were brought forward in the early 1890s. In 1891, two different commodity exchanges were attempted to be established by two different tradesmen, however, the General Commodity Exchange regulations specified only one commodity exchange in each city. Therefore, upon the inspections by the Ministry of Public Works, Nişli Hacı Ali Efendi’s Commodity Exchange was declared as the sole legal exchange in the city and it was inaugurated with a ceremony on Monday, 13 June 1892.
The first elections were held at the end of that year and the first board of directors was formed. The regulations came into effect on 21 January 1895. The products traded at the Exchange in 1897 were barley, wheat, refined flour, semolina, bran, rye, flour, corn, maize, chickpea, dry beans, black-eyed pea, hemp seed, vetch, aniseed, dent corn, sesame, broad bean, poppy seed, olive oil, cotton, cotton seed and opium poppy. The public was informed daily of the transactions and prices through the local newspapers, which made monitoring supply and demand volume of the market possible.
As the economic life was severely damaged and agricultural production decreased during the World War I and Turkish Independence War, İzmir Commodity Exchange experienced rough times. Following the independence of Turkey and declaration of the republic, the present building of the İzmir Commodity Exchange was built and opened with a ceremony on 11 June 1928.
Since then, İzmir Commodity Exchange has been serving its members and the society in general in the same building, the Exchange Palace, located at Gazi Boulevard No:2, Konak/İzmir.
==Affiliates, subsidiaries and joint ventures of the ICE== * [http://www.elidas.com.tr/ Aegean Agricultural Products Licensed Warehouse Inc. (ELIDAS)] * [http://www.izbep.org.tr/ İzmir Commodity Exchange Electronic Platform (ICEEP)] * [http://www.ecommoditybazaar.com/ "E-Commodity Bazaar" Electronic Commodity Trading Portal] * [http://www.itb.org.tr/en/Page/24-turkish-derivatives-exchange-turkdex Turkish Derivatives Exchange (TURKDEX)]
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Izmir Commodity Exchange}} [[Category:1891 establishments]] [[Category:Business organizations based in Turkey]] [[Category:Commodity exchanges]]

{{Infobox Mayor | name = Željko Kerum | image = | office = [[Member of Parliament of Croatia|Member of Parliament]] | term_start = 22 December 2011 | term_end = 28 September 2015 | primeminister = [[Zoran Milanović]] | constituency = X electoral district | order2 = 70th | office2 = Mayor of Split | term_start2 = 1 June 2009 | term_end2 = 7 June 2013 | deputy2 = Željko Šundov | predecessor2 = [[Ivan Kuret]] | successor2 = [[Ivo Baldasar]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1960|9|25}} | birth_place = Ogorje near [[Muć]], [[PR Croatia]], [[FPR Yugoslavia]] (now [[Croatia]]) | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = [[Politician]], [[entrepreneur]] | profession = Mechanical technician | spouse = Ankica Ana Kerum <small>(divorced)</small> | partner = Fani Horvat <small>(since 2010)</small> | children = 5 | relatives = [[Nevenka Bečić]] <small>(sister)</small> | alma_mater = | party = [[Croatian Civic Party]] (HGS) }} '''Željko Kerum''' (born 25 September 1960) is a [[Croatia]]n [[entrepreneur]] and a [[politician]].<ref name=sd_kok>{{cite web |url=http://www.slobodnadalmacija.hr/Hrvatska/tabid/66/articleType/ArticleView/articleId/45248/Default.aspx |title=Kerum voli Kuma, Kuret Bonda, a Ostojić Forrest Gumpa |date=2009-03-09 |accessdate=2009-05-02 |language=Croatian |work=[[Slobodna Dalmacija]] |last=Kovačić |first=Leo}}</ref> He was [[Mayor of Split|mayor]] of [[Split (city)|Split]], between 2009 and 2013, after which he failed to qualify for the second round of elections. He also owned the [[supermarket chain]] ''[[Kerum (supermarket chain)|Kerum]]'' until it folded in 2012.
==Early life== Željko Kerum was born in the village of Ogorje (part of [[Muć]]) in the [[Zagora (Croatia)|Dalmatian hinterland]]. He graduated from the Technical High School in [[Split (city)|Split]], [[Croatia]] in 1978. In 1981 he got his first job in the Split construction company ''Melioracija'' spending a year in [[Iraq]] working on military bases.
==Business career== He founded the company ''Kerum'' in 1989, opening his first [[convenience store]] in 1990. Six years later he opened his first [[supermarket]] in the [[Lora (Split)|Lora]] neighborhood of Split. In 2003 he bought the ''Diokom'' industrial facilities (ex-''Jugoplastika'') and in 2007 he opened the ''Joker'' Shopping Mall, the largest in [[Dalmatia]] at the time.<ref name=bio>{{cite web |url=http://zeljkokerumsplit.com/biografija-zeljka-keruma/ |title=Biografija Željka Keruma |work=Zeljkokerumsplit.com |language=Croatian |accessdate=2009-05-02}}</ref>
==Politics== In the first round of the 2009 elections for mayor of Split, Kerum (independent) won 40.21% of the popular vote, while his closest rival [[Ranko Ostojić]] ([[Social Democratic Party of Croatia|SDP]]) won 34.72%.<ref name=izbori>{{cite web |url=http://www.izbori.hr/2009Lokalni/rezultati/rezultati.html |title=Rezultati lokalnih izbora 2009 |date=2009-05-18 |accessdate=2009-05-18 |language=Croatian}}</ref> On May 31, he won 58.42% of the vote, making him the incumbent mayor of Split.<ref name=JL>{{cite web |url=http://jutarnji.hr/vijesti/izbori2009/detalji/art-2009,5,31,,165294.jl |title=Kerum: Zaposlit ću sve i riješiti stambene probleme |work=Jutarnji.hr |language=Croatian |accessdate=2009-06-02}}</ref>
In September 2009 during a live television interview on the ''[[Nedjeljom u 2]]'' talk show that airs on the Croatian state broadcaster [[HRT 1]], in response to host [[Aleksandar Stanković (journalist)|Aleksandar Stanković]]'s question if Serb businessmen are welcome in Croatia, Kerum answered: "If it was up to me I wouldn't let them because [[Serbs]] never brought us anything good in the past and they won't do it now. Not only Serbs, but also [[Montenegrins (ethnic group)|Montenegrins]]. And whoever is doing business with them will not make out OK". Asked further by Stanković if he would accept a man of Serb ethnicity as a son-in-law, Kerum answered emphatically: "No, never".
On January 16, 2011 the citizens of [[Split, Croatia|Split]], on the initiative of an informal group of citizens gathered on [[Facebook]], protested at the Prva voda beach on the park mountain [[Marjan, Split|Marjan]] in Split against a change of city urban planning regulation that allowed construction of restaurants and bars in the beach area. According to plans, on the proposed beach site a company owned by his mistress Fani Horvat planned to build such an object, with the destruction of protected wood area. The idea was perceived as a nepotistic venture and favouring of Kerum's own interests instead of the city's.<ref>http://www.slobodnadalmacija.hr/Split/tabid/72/articleType/ArticleView/articleId/126890/Default.aspx</ref> Kerum also caused a stir in Split when he proposed to build a 40 meter tall statue of Christ the Redeemer to rival that of Brazil.
In 2011, he became a candidate in the [[Croatian parliamentary election, 2011]] on the electoral list of the [[Croatian Democratic Union]].<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.poslovni.hr/vijesti/hdz-predao-izborne-liste-kosor-prva-u-petoj-jedinici-190541.aspx | language = Croatian | title = HDZ predao izborne liste, Kosor prva u petoj jedinici | newspaper = [[Poslovni dnevnik]] | date = 2011-11-14 | accessdate = 2011-11-14}}</ref>
In the [[Croatian local elections, 2013]] Kerum won only 18.57% of the popular vote while re-running for mayor, which did not qualify him to the second round of the elections. Also, Kerum's [[Croatian Civic Party]] won only 12.41% of the popular votes for the city council of Split.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.index.hr/vijesti/clanak/bandic-pobjednik-kerum-porazen-milanovic-ponizen/678557.aspx | title = Bandić pobjednik, Kerum poražen, Milanović ponižen | language = Croatian | date = 20 May 2013 | accessdate = 4 June 2013}}</ref>
In the [[Croatian parliamentary election, 2015]], his Croatian civic party won only 2234 votes in the two Dalmatian constituencies and became a non-parliamentary party.
==Personal life==
In 1989 Kerum married Anka Lalin, with whom he has a daughter and son. In 2009, he surprised the public by publicly announcing he was divorcing his wife to be with his pregnant mistress Fani Horvat, who was nearly 25 years his junior. The news caused many in the media to point out the hypocrisy in his political image, where he has consistently presented himself as a supporter of traditional values and a conservative world view, but had been participating in an extramarital affair.<ref>http://www.net.hr/vijesti/hrvatska/page/2009/10/19/0640006.html</ref>
Kerum has been known to own expensive cars including a [[Hummer]], a [[Mercedes S500]], a [[BMW 7]], a [[Maybach 62]], a [[Ferrari F430]], and a [[Ferrari 599 GTB Fiorano]].<ref name="24 sata">{{cite web | url=http://www.24sata.hr/news/prijatelju-posudis-ti-meni-malo-taj-svoj-novi-ferrari/155866/ | title=Prijatelju, posudiš ti meni malo taj svoj novi Ferrari? | work=[[24 sata (Croatia)|24 sata]] | date=January 26, 2010 | language=Croatian | accessdate=2010-02-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://arhiv.slobodnadalmacija.hr/20030826/automoto01.asp | title=Maybach u Splitu! | work=[[Slobodna Dalmacija]] | date=August 26, 2003 | language=Croatian | accessdate=2010-02-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.index.hr/vijesti/clanak/kerum-vozi-ferrari-kupljen-na-braniteljsku-povlasticu/427020.aspx | title=Kerum vozi Ferrari kupljen na braniteljsku povlasticu? | work=[[Index.hr]] | date=March 25, 2009 | language=Croatian | accessdate=2010-02-23}}</ref> His [[Cessna Citation X]], a [[business jet]] worth approximately US$17 million, is the most expensive privately owned aircraft in Croatia.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.jutarnji.hr/kerumova-cessna-najskuplji-hrvatski-privatni-zrakoplov/841530/ | title=Kerumova Cessna najskuplji hrvatski privatni zrakoplov | date=June 24, 2010 | work=[[Jutarnji list]] | language=Croatian | accessdate=2010-06-24}}</ref>
